abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome for the Urban Development
            Project for Swaziland was satisfactory, the sustainability
            was likely, the institutional development impact was modest,
            and the Bank and borrower performance were both
            satisfactory. Lessons learned from the project: The project
            faced a number of implementation challenges as a result of
            the low institutional base at the start of the project and
            the complexity of project design. In countries such as
            Swaziland loans should be denominated in South African Rands
            (legal tender in Swaziland) rather than USD. During the
            supervision of projects, project progress needs to be
            assessed against a number of variables  rather than using
            the rate of Loan disbursement as the sole indicator.
            Finally, the complex design of the project reflected the
            complex urban development challenges facing the Swazis in
            the early 90s.
